name: legendarily
content:

in a way that is very well-known, and admired or spoken about a lot: On opening night she came face-to-face with the legendarily difficult playwright. He legendarily either couldn't or wouldn't use a computer.
More examplesFewer examplesHe could be legendarily surly, but seemed to have mellowed following his marriage and the birth of his daughter. He is a visionary who legendarily drives himself, his crew and his movies through chaos and into creativity. During a legendarily corrupt career, he accepted payments of many millions of pounds.
